intro: Hieracium nutatulum, commonly known as the downy hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 10–30 centimeters and features upright stems covered in fine, downy hairs. The plant produces yellow flowers in clusters, which bloom from late spring to early summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a slightly hairy texture. Hieracium nutatulum is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, and it is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
